lead_paragraph: SINGH--Jyoti Shankar. Noted Internationalist and Author, Dies at 80. A former Deputy Executive Director of the United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA) Executive Coordinator of the 1984 International Conference on Population in Cairo, and Executive coordinator of the 2001 World Conference Against Racism in Durban, South Africa, as well as a Permanent Observer to the United Nations for Partners on Population and Development, Mr. Singh died Tuesday January 11th. A renowned expert on population issues whose career spanned more than five decades, Mr. Singh authored eight books. A consummate professional, he was a masterful planner of large scale international conferences, always distinguished by his attention to detail. Jyoti Shankar Singh was born on April 15, 1935 in Pathalgaon, India to Brijnath Kumar and Tirthmani Singh and obtained several degrees from Banaras University, India, an MA from New York University in 1979, and a Doctor (honoris causa) Degree from the International Institute Integration, Bolivia, 1980. In the early part of his career he was a Secretary General of the World Assembly of Youth, Brussels, 1966-1972 before his extensive career at the United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA). He is survived by his wife and partner of 54 years, Mariluz Singh Molares; children Anil Singh- Molares of Seattle, WA; Rajeev Singh-Molares; and Ajit Singh-Molares of London, UK; and eight grandchildren whom he loved dearly. 1/3
